question: The shape of the torque/slip curve of an induction motor is:
Introducing the external resistance increases____.i. Speed ii. Output power iii. Starting torque
Introducing the external resistance decreases____. i. Speed ii. Output power iii. Starting torque
What happens to the slip of a three-phase induction motor as the load on the motor increases?

answers.a: The slip decreases, causing the motor to speed up.
answers.b: The slip remains constant, regardless of the load.
answers.c: The slip increases, causing the motor to slow down.
answers.d: The slip oscillates, leading to unstable motor operation.
